I posted to get some support, rather than to be judged.  I have not touched anything for almost 4 months.  AND I MEAN NOTHING.  I am a child psychologist who works with abused and neglected kids, so i am very very concerned about the well being of children.  I have been having a rough time lately and I thought that there was no way I could be pregnant or I would not have touched anything.  In addition, I used a condom because I was going to wait a couple months before trying again.  I would do absolutely anything to ensure the well being of my child and I am really disappointed that I go to a place like this to get some support and I get a response that suggests I am a irresponsible person, which I am not.  I have had two miscarriages in three months.  I have endured pretty bad cramps for the last week.  I even called the doctor to confirm my belief that it was almost impossible to be pregnant, WHO AGREED!  I must say I am very hurt and disappointed by your response.  I just wanted a break from the emotional and physical pain for one weekend.  I hope the next time you make a mistake someone is more empathetic and understanding with you.  I am in crisis and very very upset.  You should be ashamed of yourself

Actually, they do not know when alcohol is safe and when it isn't at any point during a pregnancy whether it is 4 weeks or 8 months.  That is why Fetal Alcohol Syndrome is incurable and unpreventable.  Because of this, this is why doctors suggest that while trying to conceive that you behave as if you are pregnant.  Some people who drink and smoke can have healthy children, but that is a fluke, not the norm.

My doctor also said that having one drink per week was no big deal while TTC.  She said it could even help when your anxious about it.  I work with a lot of FAS kids and have done tons of interview with parents.  None have ever said that they just had a couple drinks while TTC.  They were all alcoholics and drank consistently throughout the pregnancy.  It is extremely rare to get FAS without ongoing binge drinking throughout the pregnancy.  I even presented a paper on it in grad school.I think her point was trying to get me to calm down and I have.  Even though the doctor said one drink per week was okay, I didnt until this weekend because I wasnt TTC and thought i was in the clear this month.  I just get super freaked out and my brain doesnt quite work right when I am under extreme stress.  I think I have collected myself.  I am going to retest.

i have clients with fetal alcohol syndrom and have studied its effect greatly. it is correct that they don't know to what extent alcohol effect PG. but the facts have shown that 3 or more drinks through out PG seems to gaurentee FAS and FAE. most doc DO NOT tell a woman to NOT consume alcohol while TTCing. they suggest to use common sense and have only a couple of drinks if you are going to. the 1st 2 weeks of PG you haven't even 'o'ed yet and so there is no reason to not or to have a glass of wine or a beer if you want to. after 'o' it takes 6-10 days to implant...so during that time the baby has not even attached. after that period of time when implant would be likely to occur it is wise to stay away from alcohol if you are TTCing just cuz it makes sense...i do agree. i am saying that for those woman who had no clue they could be PG and had a couple of drinks before a BFP should not upset themselves because it HAS been proven that the implanted egg is not attatched to maternal blood stream. it is nourished by the inner nutrients in the egg itself, the yoke sac, and exchanges O2 from the pool of blood that is formed during implant.i am not trying to sound rude or anything pls don't feel i am. i have a degree in biology and specialize in genetics and congenital defects...including FAS and FAE. and have studied to great lengths all the things that can go wrong in early PG. most woman who take care of themselves and stop possible detrimental behavior after a BFP will give birth to healthy babies.love....kimmie....hope this not AF and an implant bleed...heres to a BFP!!!!

when i was nursing DS i was told that if i had a drink to wait an hour per drink i had to nurse again. i would pump if i had a drink and give DS a bottle of stored breast milk. i was also told if i had a hard time with let down to have a beer to relax me....it wouldn't be in my current breast milk. i haven't BF in over 8 yrs....and have not done any research so don't know of the latest studies on that...and what they recommend now.i have seen the march of dimes site before....but studies are so much more intense and i use medical sites for my thesis' and most of my research comes from the Library of Congress and active studies by MD's and researchers in medical journals. i have found the info there to be more scientific with actual facts and figures. the places i get my research from are usually for students and other docs/researchers to compare trials and research patters. i do love the march of dimes site and what they stand for though and support them financially for all they do. it isn't a source that my team uses for a source of medical research is all.love.....kimmie

I also agree with you about abstaining while trying to conceive.  I have Ankylosing Spondylitis which causes me a lot of pain in my back, hips, and elbows.  It will continue to spread throughout my joints and anything connected to them as it is incurable and systemic.  There are a lot of times where I want to take a pain pill to ease some of the pain I feel daily or steroids to increase the effectiveness of my Remicade, an infusion I get every 6 weeks.  While trying to conceive, I do neither.  That is my choice.  I am not saying I fault others for their choices while trying to conceive.  I just want to say that it is possible.

And to clear things up I think drinking anything at all in pregnancy or taking anything (like a pain reliever) is not okay. I myself went though severe preeclampsia and preterm labor and would not take even a Tylenol even when I was feeling my worst. I hardly ever drink and I wouldn't have had anything to drink if I had any thought in my head that I was pregnant. I think it's just plan wrong.

question: Okay, I really need you guys today. I have had two miscarriages over the summer (last one was on Sept 4 at 5 wks). I have had feelings all week like I am going to start, but I dont. To be on the safe side I took pregnancy tests on Sun. Wed. & Fri. (first response) and nothing. I even called the OB/GYN and explained the cramps, moodiness, breaking out, and no period after 33 days, and she also said that it was normal to feel this way because my body had not gotten back to a normal cycle and to give it some time to start AF.  She said it was highly unlikely that I was pg given I ovulated and had sex the last time about three weeks ago. After the call, I popped a bunch of Advil for the cramps and continued to take a lot of Advil since. I went out to dinner with my husband and had several drinks on Fri. I worked out really really hard yesturday and last night I went to a Mexican place (shellfish) and had a few margaritas. I have been drinking a lot of caffine in the last couple of days too. Basically all the things I cut out for so long because I thought there was no possilbe way I could be pregnant. WELL, this morning I got this really weird feeling and decided to take another hpt (I dont even no what possessed me) and got a very very very faint line pretty quickly. I am sitting here crying because I dont know what to think. If I had any clue this could happen.  I would not have done any of the things I have done lately.  It scares me that I have such a faint line this much later and petrified of having another miscarriage.  I feel so completely overwhelmed, scared, and guilt
